stuartcarnie commented on pull request #3275: ARROW-4126: [Go] offset not used when accessing boolean array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3275#discussion_r245745370
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/array/boolean.go
 ##########
 @@ -45,7 +45,12 @@ func NewBooleanData(data *Data) *Boolean {
 	return a
 }
 
-func (a *Boolean) Value(i int) bool { return bitutil.BitIsSet(a.values, i) }
+func (a *Boolean) Value(i int) bool {
+	if i < 0 || i >= a.array.data.length {
 
 Review comment:
   `BitIsSet` is going to panic if the index is out of bounds, so there is no need to perform this check here
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

stuartcarnie commented on pull request #3275: ARROW-4126: [Go] offset not used when accessing boolean array
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3275#discussion_r245798096
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/array/boolean.go
 ##########
 @@ -45,7 +45,12 @@ func NewBooleanData(data *Data) *Boolean {
 	return a
 }
 
-func (a *Boolean) Value(i int) bool { return bitutil.BitIsSet(a.values, i) }
+func (a *Boolean) Value(i int) bool {
+	if i < 0 || i >= a.array.data.length {
 
 Review comment:
   We've been focused on a performance-first approach with similar semantics to the C++ implementation and not performing bounds checks similar APIs, however, I think it is reasonable in this case, to avoid undefined behavior. We may wish to formalize where we make these tradeoffs.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: When accessing a boolean array, the offset of the underlying data buffer is not used. This affects the behavior of slicing. See [https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/3273] .
fields.summary: [Go] offset not used when accessing boolean array
